title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement meteorodata@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: outlines propose change meteorodata. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("MatiFasolato/meteorodata", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to meteorodata
text: Please note meteorodata project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Matías Fasolato. Author, maintainer. Bautista Torregiani. Author.

title: Authors and Citation

what: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos.
title: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos.
text: El objetivo del paquete ‘meteorodata’ es facilitar el análisis de datos meteorológicos y la manipulación de los mismos mediante funciones implementadas en este paquete.

title: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos.
text: can install development version meteorodata GitHub :

title: Paquete Creado Con el Fin de Colaborar con el Analisis de Datos Meteorologicos.
text: Este es un ejemplo básico que muestra cómo instalar la librería del paquete:
code: library(meteorodata) library(lubridate) #>  #> Adjuntando el paquete: 'lubridate' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union  F_to_C(100) #> [1] 37.77778  estacion_met <- descargar_datos("NH0098", "data_raw/NH0098.csv") #> Lectura del archivo de estación 'NH0098' head(estacion_met,5) #>       id      fecha temperatura_abrigo_150cm temperatura_abrigo_150cm_maxima #> 1 NH0098 1956-04-01                    13.65                            21.6 #> 2 NH0098 1956-04-02                    16.75                            23.6 #> 3 NH0098 1956-04-03                    19.00                            25.9 #> 4 NH0098 1956-04-04                    17.55                            23.6 #> 5 NH0098 1956-04-05                    20.00                            27.2 #>   temperatura_abrigo_150cm_minima temperatura_intemperie_5cm_minima #> 1                             5.7                               4.1 #> 2                             9.9                               8.4 #> 3                            12.1                              10.8 #> 4                            11.5                              10.5 #> 5                            12.8                              11.1 #>   temperatura_intemperie_50cm_minima temperatura_suelo_5cm_media #> 1                                 NA                          NA #> 2                                 NA                          NA #> 3                                 NA                          NA #> 4                                 NA                          NA #> 5                                 NA                          NA #>   temperatura_suelo_10cm_media temperatura_inte_5cm #> 1                           NA                   NA #> 2                           NA                   NA #> 3                           NA                   NA #> 4                           NA                   NA #> 5                           NA                   NA #>   temperatura_intemperie_150cm_minima humedad_suelo precipitacion_pluviometrica #> 1                                  NA            NA                           0 #> 2                                  NA            NA                           0 #> 3                                  NA            NA                           0 #> 4                                  NA            NA                           0 #> 5                                  NA            NA                           0 #>   granizo nieve heliofania_efectiva heliofania_relativa tesion_vapor_media #> 1       0     0                  NA                  NA                8.3 #> 2       0     0                  NA                  NA               10.4 #> 3       0     0                  NA                  NA               13.2 #> 4       0     0                  NA                  NA               10.6 #> 5       0     0                  NA                  NA               11.6 #>   humedad_media humedad_media_8_14_20 rocio_medio duracion_follaje_mojado #> 1            NA                    62         4.3                      NA #> 2            NA                    71         7.5                      NA #> 3            NA                    78        11.1                      NA #> 4            NA                    70         7.8                      NA #> 5            NA         NA #> 3                          7.2                     NA #> 4                          7.2                     NA #> 5                          5.6                     NA #>   velocidad_viento_1000cm_media direccion_viento_1000cm velocidad_viento_maxima #> 1                             4                                              NA #> 2                            13         NA                 NA #> 2            NA               NA             NA                 NA #> 3            NA               NA             NA                 NA #> 4            NA NA #> 4                           NA               NA   0.000000          NA #> 5                           NA               NA   0.000000          NA  C_to_F(23) #> [1] 73.4  grafico <- grafico_temperatura_mensual(   read.csv("data_raw/NH0098.csv"),   colores = c("blue", "yellow"),   titulo = "Promedio Mensual de Temperatura para NH0098" ) #>  #> Adjuntando el paquete: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union grafico #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`). #> `geom_line()`: Each group consists of only one observation. #> ℹ Do you need to adjust the group aesthetic? #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). tabla_resumen_temperatura(NH_unidos,c('NH0910','NH0437')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 9 #>   id     observaciones_temperatura proporcion_NA temperatura_minima #>   <chr>                      <int>         <dbl>              <dbl> #> 1 NH0437                     18738       0.0101 promedio_anual_temperatura <dbl>, #> #   precipitacion_acumulada_mensual <dbl>

what: Conversión de la temperatura en Centigrados a Fahrenheit — C_to_F
title: Conversión de la temperatura en Centigrados a Fahrenheit — C_to_F
text: La función C_to_F() toma un valor numérico de la temperatura en Centigrados y calcula la equivalencia en grados fahrenheit.

title: Conversión de la temperatura en Centigrados a Fahrenheit — C_to_F

text: temp_fahrenheit un vector numérico de la temperatura en Centigrados

what: Descarga de datos de distintas estaciones — descargar_datos
title: Descarga de datos de distintas estaciones — descargar_datos
text: La función descargar_datos() toma 2 parámetros y permite la lectura y/o descarga del dataset de la estación que se solicite.

title: Descarga de datos de distintas estaciones — descargar_datos
Descarga de datos de distintas estaciones — descargar_datos
text: id_estacion un string conformado por numeros y letras ruta ubicación del dataset en nuestro proyecto

title: Descarga de datos de distintas estaciones — descargar_datos
text: Devuelve la información contenida en el dataset descargado

title: Descarga de datos de distintas estaciones — descargar_datos
text: Estaciones Disponibles: NH0437 NH0098 NH0046 NH0910 NH0472

title: Descarga de datos de distintas estaciones — descargar_datos
code: data <- descargar_datos("NH0098", "data_raw/NH0098.csv") #> Warning: URL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rse-r/intro-programacion/main/datos/NH0098.csv: cannot open destfile 'data_raw/NH0098.csv', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: download had nonzero exit status #> Warning: cannot open file 'data_raw/NH0098.csv': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection

what: Gráfico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
title: Gráfico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
text: Esta función recibe un data frame con datos de una o más estaciones y devuelve un gráfico con el promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo 150 cm.

title: Gráfico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
Gráfico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
text: datos un data frame con los datos de las estaciones. colores un vector de colores para utilizar en el gráfico. titulo un string con el título del gráfico. Si se define, el título por defecto será "Temperatura".

title: Gráfico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
text: Un gráfico con el promedio mensual de la temperatura.

title: Gráfico del promedio mensual de la temperatura de abrigo — grafico_temperatura_mensual
code: # Suponiendo que 'data' es un data frame con las estaciones NH0098 y NH0437: grafico_temperatura_mensual(data, colores = c("blue", "red"), titulo = "Promedio Mensual de Temperatura") #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union #> Error in library(ggplot2): there is no package called ‘ggplot2’
